授業目的:
Students will further develop the writing skills they learned in the spring semester
• To help students improve their vocabulary and grammar with a focus on academic writing
• To provide students with a fundamental understanding of the discourse of writing, and to guide the development of their critical thinking skills
• To provide students with guidance and practice in gaining a more advanced understanding of how to use punctuation in academic writing, as well as introducing the concept of using cited research and quotations in academic writing while avoiding plagiarism • To engage students in writing
for fluency through a variety of topics
• To use proper citation in academic writing

At the end of the semester, students should be able to write an effective essay in English in one or more styles. Students are expected to be able to write a structured essay with evidence of critical thinking with an Introduction Paragraph (Hook, Thesis Statement, Outline), well-supported and clear Body Paragraphs (Topic Sentence, Supporting Sentences, and a Concluding Sentence), and a Conclusion Paragraph (Restatement of Thesis Statement and Summary)
. help of research articles in English, students will be able to write research-related-essays. They should also be able to demonstrate written proficiency in English grammar and punctuation via feedback from the instructor.
到達目標:
• Review paragraph structure
• Examine topic sentences
• Learn Institute of Electrical and Electriconics Engineering (IEEE) citation
• Expand from paragraphs to short essays
• Organizing a descriptive short essay
• Using adjectives to add details sentences to
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】英語ライティングIIＢ　２（理学部）/英語ライティングIIＢ　２（理工学部）/英語ライティングIIＢ　２（工学部）/英語ライティングIIＢ　２（生命環境学部）

授業方法: Classes are face-to-face. Students are expected to attend classes on campus unless granted special permission by the University.

トピック.授業計画1:
Writing Journals
The writing journals are graded practice for the free-writing topics. Writing prompts will be given for each assignment. Students are expected to use proper English writing structures. Feedback will be provided. Textbook Activities The textbook is used in the classroom

to
introduce grammar, vocabulary, and correct writing structures. The students are expected to complete the textbook exercises in a timely manner.

Review Assignments
Review assignments are conducted at the end of each unit. They are intended to show competence with the unit material.

Freewriting topics
The details for the Freewriting Topics will be posted in LUNA.
トピック.授業外学習2:
HOMEWORK
● Please use class time effectively to avoid unnecessary homework.
● Assignments are due at the beginning of class. Late assignments are assigned a penalty of 50% without an official note.
